snippet: Bad debts have been a drag on economic activity ever since the financial crisis of 2008, but the threat appears to be rising, and China is the biggest source of worry.
abstract: Many financial experts are increasingly worried about bad Chinese debt, which some estimate could exceed $5 trillion; worry is compounded by fact that Chinese banks have pulled back on lending, which may slow nation's economic growth even further, making it harder to pay such debts off, and have ripple effect on world economy.
lead_paragraph: Bad debts have been a drag on economic activity ever since the financial crisis of 2008, but the threat appears to be rising, and China is the biggest source of worry.

headline.main: Toxic Loans Around the World Weigh on Global Growth
headline.print_headline: Worth Trillions, Bad Loans Haunt Global Economy
